parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To go past, pass by, pass along by. From para and poreuomai; to travel near.
Early in the morning, at dawn. Adverb from pro; at dawn; by implication, the day-break watch.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fig-tree. From sukon; a fig-tree.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To dry up, parch, be ripened, wither, waste away. From xeros; to desiccate; by implication, to shrivel, to mature.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A root, shoot, source; that which comes from the root, a descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'root'.
